newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Karrie seen making modest gain on debut.
newsitem.headline: Karrie seen making modest gain on debut.

text.p: Shares of computer casing manufacturer Karrie International Holdings Ltd are poised for modest gains in their trading debut on Monday but the strength is expected to be short-lived, analysts said on Thursday.
"A 20 percent gain on the stock is expected in view of its subscription level, but profit-taking may emerge to limit its rise in its first trading day," said one local analyst.
The debut of the heavily oversubscribed Guangdong Tannery Ltd on the same day should distract investor attention on Karrie since it was relatively less attractive fundamentally, analysts said.
Karrie offered 90 million new shares at HK$1.15 each in an initial public offering (IPO) of shares in Hong Kong. The IPO was 60.7 times subscribed.
The company said the net proceeds would be used to repay loans and to buy surface mount technology machines for the manufacture of printed circuit board assemblies.
